tweets.text: As bad as the stink is (and it's bad) the greater worry is what it indicates. That residents around #WalleysQuarry are breathing Hydrogen Sulfide every day. Thousands of people. Hundreds of children. @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/Ztm5kuIOnO

We‚Äôre counting down the days to the reopening of the riverside path alongside the River Lune.

It's currently being resurfaced, and all being well, should be open next Thurs afternoon (Apr 1).

The path has been closed since last Feb due to the building of new flood defences. https://t.co/SZM2uM5dLu

Yes please, this area is already classed as social-economically deprived & is already at risk from high air pollution (+covid on top).Equality principles must be applied here - we deserve to breathe clean air the same as everyone else @PHE_uk @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency https://t.co/nvHLRBpGUC

tweets.text: Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.

tweets.text: Confess I'm not usually one for pet videos - but this dog is phenomenal! New flood defence initiative, @EnvAgencySE ? https://t.co/CPCrjyXGc9

We‚Äôre replacing the gates at #DaysLock #Oxfordshire and refurbishing the whole complex in readiness for people getting back on the #Thames this summer. Hope to see you on the river when it‚Äôs safe. https://t.co/jzBVcZVbLq

Understand the @EnvAgency have received an application from HS2 to approve the environmental permit to allow them to start tunnelling. We are told by the @EnvAgency that this is not be open for consultancy even through there is significant risk to our rivers and water supply.

@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL Gaslighting- does this sound like anyone we know? Downplaying things it‚Äôs done wrong,discrediting or using controversy to divert attention from important events. It‚Äôs laughable if it wasn‚Äôt so serious. @EnvAgency time to step up and deal with this utter shambles #stopthestink https://t.co/0nXk5cY9bF

tweets.text:
@EnvAgencyYNE At the other end of the scale 
After the #drought situation this year #2018 , where will all the extra houses sprouting up all around #pocklington get their #watersupplies in the future??

Our green spaces include our #rivers & #canals. They are special places for us all to enjoy. Today the team deployed as part of #OpClampDown9 with local police, @EnvAgencySW Fishery Enforcement, @AnglingTrust Volunteer Bailiffs & @PoliceDrones to help tackle illegal fishing & ASB https://t.co/bKwYi1BWWg
How exciting. Tempting for üö¥ ride when #covidroadmap ok‚Äôs leisure travel away from home area. https://t.co/TpfbdStsrw

Ceremony to mark start of construction on ¬£4.7m flood alleviation scheme with water storage area to better protect 140 homes in Pocklington from flood risk held today. https://t.co/nJTVxsrMFk https://t.co/kiwbWqMnSA

@Feargal_Sharkey @PJennings88 @EnvAgency "But the plans were on display‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚ÄúOn display? I eventually had to go down to the cellar to find them.‚Äù
‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the display department.‚Äù
‚ÄúWith a flashlight.‚Äù
‚ÄúAh, well, the lights had probably gone.‚Äù
‚ÄúSo had the stairs.‚Äù
‚ÄúBut look, you found the notice, didn‚Äôt you?‚Äù
.. 1/2
A real concern that the @EnvAgency approval for HS2 Tunnelling will be pushed through without adequate scrutiny. https://t.co/b5o9gOr7mR

As we head towards #netzero, I predict the whole construction industry will switch to low carbon concrete, this scheme has helped speed that up. With #COP26 climate talks coming to Glasgow, the Hythe Ranges sea defence scheme demonstrates adaptation and mitigation in one project. https://t.co/1wacBkNG8y
